name: Alison
body: Why is it important to reduce fragmentation with interleaved allocations?

name: Yulduz
body: Computer security can be tricky to get just right

name: Takako
body: Alison, long-running processes that need to manage a lot of temporary data (such as an operating system), the fragmentation will build up over time and require copying data from one place to another in a process known as defragmentation. This copying can be very costly in terms of CPU time, leading to temporary hiccups in responsiveness which can escalate into improper behavior in complex systems.

name: Gizella
body: Agreed, but it's well worth it to continually improve our understanding and code!
